returns._0: The close factor, scaled by 1e18, representing the maximum portion of a borrow that can be repaid in a single liquidation

params.cTokens: An array of cToken addresses to enter into as collateral markets

returns._0: An array of results indicating success (0) or failure (non-zero error codes) for each market entered

params.account: The address of the account to query

returns.liquidity: The excess liquidity of the account, scaled by 1e18
returns.shortfall: The shortfall of the account (if any), scaled by 1e18

params.actualRepayAmount: The actual amount of the underlying borrowed asset being repaid
params.cTokenBorrowed: The address of the borrowed cToken
params.cTokenCollateral: The address of the collateral cToken

returns.seizeTokens: The number of cTokens that can be seized as collateral

returns._0: The liquidation incentive, scaled by 1e18, which represents the additional collateral that liquidators receive as a bonus

params.cTokenAddress: The address of the cToken market to query

returns.collateralFactorMantissa: The collateral factor for this market, scaled by 1e18
returns.isComped: Whether the market is included in COMP distribution
returns.isListed: Whether the market is listed in the Compound protocol

closeFactorMantissa().notice: Get the current close factor used in liquidation calculations

enterMarkets(address[]).notice: Enter one or more markets to enable the use of the corresponding assets as collateral

getAccountLiquidity(address).notice: Get the current liquidity status of an account

liquidateCalculateSeizeTokens(address,ad.notice: Calculate the number of cTokens to seize in the event of a liquidation

liquidationIncentiveMantissa().notice: Get the current liquidation incentive used in liquidation calculations

markets(address).notice: Get information about a specific market within the Compound protocol
